title: Volatile nightmare staff (beta)

properties.value: The Volatile nightmare staff is a staff requiring level 75 Magic and 50 Hitpoints to wield. It is only available from the tournament supplies table in a tournament world as a test weapon for players. It is one of the proposed rewards for Nightmare of Ashihama. content:
Volatile nightmare staff (beta) is a temporary piece of content found only in unrestricted worlds.
The contents of this page refer to a piece of content only available on temporary unrestricted worlds as a means to test it before release.
Its design is subject to change, and the graphics are used as a placeholder.
Volatile nightmare staff
Released28 November 2019 (Update)
Removal11 December 2019 (Update)

Item IDhist24424

The Volatile nightmare staff is a staff requiring level 75 Magic and 50 Hitpoints to wield. It is only available from the tournament supplies table in a tournament world as a test weapon for players. It is one of the proposed rewards for Nightmare of Ashihama. It can autocast offensive standard spells as well as Ancient Magicks.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performing the volatile nightmare staff's special attack, Immolate.

The volatile nightmare staff has a special attack, Immolate, that consumes 55% of the player's special attack energy to hit the target with 50% increased accuracy and dealing a high amount of damage.

The base damage for Immolate is scaled based on the player's Magic level, ranging from 50 at level 75 to 66 at level 99, which can be increased with magic damage boosting items. At level 99, the maximum possible hit is 82, or 93 while on a Slayer task.

As the weapon is being tested, the special attack animation uses the animation of Flames of Zamorak as a placeholder.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
5 December 2019
(update)
  • The staff now has an additional requirement of 50 Hitpoints to wield.
  • The amount of special attack energy required for Invocate has been increased from 50% to 55%.
  • Invocate's animation was updated; the wielder now uses a unique attack animation, rather than the attack animation used when casting Ancient Magicks.
  • The idle animation when wielding the staff has been changed, with the chain now slightly swinging about.
29 November 2019
 Hotfix

The following changes were made:

  • The base damage for Immolate now scales based on the player's Magic level rather than a flat 58 base damage.
  • Immolate now hits two ticks after it is cast. To accommodate this change, Immolate's animation was updated to no longer have a projectile; previously, it used the projectile animation of Vorkath's fatal dragonfire attack.
v • d • e

[[File:Volatile nightmare staff (beta) detail.png|left|150px]]
The '''Volatile nightmare staff''' is a [[Staves|staff]] requiring level 75 [[Magic]] and 50 [[Hitpoints]] to wield. It is only available from the tournament supplies table in a [[tournament world]] as a test weapon for players. It is one of the proposed rewards for [[Nightmare of Ashihama]]. It can autocast offensive [[standard spells]] as well as [[Ancient Magicks]].

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Staff}}

==Special attack==
[[File:Immolate.gif|thumb|250px|A player performing the volatile nightmare staff's special attack, ''Immolate''.]]
The volatile nightmare staff has a [[special attack]], ''Immolate'', that consumes 55% of the player's special attack energy to hit the target with 50% increased accuracy and dealing a high amount of damage.

The base damage for Immolate is scaled based on the player's Magic level, ranging from 50 at level 75 to 66 at level 99, which can be increased with [[magic damage]] boosting items. At level 99, the maximum possible hit is 82, or 93 while on a [[Slayer task]].

As the weapon is being tested, the special attack animation uses the animation of [[Flames of Zamorak]] as a placeholder.

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 5 December 2019
|update = Game Improvements and Nightmare Beta Changes
|change = 
*The staff now has an additional requirement of 50 [[Hitpoints]] to wield.
*The amount of special attack energy required for Invocate has been increased from 50% to 55%.
*Invocate's animation was updated; the wielder now uses a unique attack animation, rather than the attack animation used when casting [[Ancient Magicks]].
*The idle animation when wielding the staff has been changed, with the chain now slightly swinging about.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 29 November 2019
|type = hotfix
|change = <nowiki/>The following changes were made:
*The base damage for Immolate now scales based on the player's Magic level rather than a flat 58 base damage.
*Immolate now hits two ticks after it is cast. To accommodate this change, Immolate's animation was updated to no longer have a projectile; previously, it used the projectile animation of [[Vorkath]]'s fatal dragonfire attack.
}}
